intro: Asplenium trichomanes pachyrachis, commonly known as the broad-leaf maidenhair fern, is a species of fern characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. It belongs to the family Athyriaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, with creeping underground stems that allow it to spread and form dense colonies. Its leaves are typically leathery and have a distinctive, intricate pattern of veins. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
